organization.fullName: Fu Xing Hospital, Capital Medical University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Quantitative Prognostic Analysis of Upper Limb Motor Dysfunction After Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Prognostic Analysis of Upper Limb Motor Dysfunction After Stroke Based on Dynamic Connection of Motion Network

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: Fu Xing Hospital, Capital Medical University

leadSponsor.name: Fu Xing Hospital, Capital Medical University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: 30% - 66% of stroke survivors have upper limb dysfunction. Effective rehabilitation can improve the prognosis, but the rehabilitation resources are limited. How to evaluate the prognosis early and formulate an individualized rehabilitation plan based on realistic expectations is still inconclusive. The current research shows that some brain network changes are related to the recovery of motor function. The dynamic connection of multi-modal and spatio-temporal fusion of motor network is helpful to the prognosis analysis of upper limb dyskinesia after stroke. 178 stroke patients will be included in this project. Fugl-Meyer motor function scale (upper limb part) and Action Research Arm Test (ARAT) will be evaluated at enrollment, 1month/3month/6month after onset. According to the results, the groups with good prognosis and poor prognosis will be distinguished; blood oxygen level dependent imaging and diffusion tensor imaging will be collected at the same time to compare the similarities and differences of the function and structural connection of the motion network; the correlation between interhemispheric connection, intrahemispheric connection, cross network connection of motor network and prognosis will be analyzed, the clinical and imaging features of different prognosis will be extracted. This study can provide scientific data support for the prognosis analysis of upper limb dysfunction after stroke, the improvement of rehabilitation clinical decision-making and the optimization of rehabilitation resource allocation.

armGroups.label: good prognosis
armGroups.description: Patients with higher Fugl-Meyer motor function scale (upper limb part) and higher Action Research Arm Test (ARAT) score.

armGroups.label: poor prognosis
armGroups.description: Patients with lower Fugl-Meyer motor function scale (upper limb part) and lower Action Research Arm Test (ARAT) score.

Functional assessment at early subacute phase
The motion network of early subacute phase with functional MRI
primaryOutcomes.description: The structural and functional connection of the motion network

primaryOutcomes.measure: The motion network of subacute phase with functional MRI
primaryOutcomes.description: The structural and functional connection of the motion network

primaryOutcomes.measure: The motion network of chronic phase with functional MRI
primaryOutcomes.description: The structural and functional connection of the motion network

primaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation analysis between changes of motor function and changes of motor network
primaryOutcomes.description: The correlation between interhemispheric connection, intrahemispheric connection, cross network connection of motor network and motor function prognosis will be analyzed
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 1 month after onset, 3 months after onset, 6 months after onset

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* First stroke with upper limb motor dysfunction, Stable condition; 18 ≤age≤80 years old; The onset time was less than 3 weeks at the time of enrollment; Sign informed consent.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Stroke patients with intracranial infection, multi-system atrophy and other central nervous system diseases; Combined with severe aphasia, visual spatial neglect and other cognitive impairment; Untreated spasm (Ashworth ≥ grade 2); Obvious joint contracture restricting the movement of upper limb; In vivo metal implants; Claustrophobia.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: stroke patients with upper limb motor dysfunction
